algorithms.name: WebTransportDatagramDuplexStream/create
algorithms.html: To create a WebTransportDatagramDuplexStream given a readable, and a writable, perform the following steps.

steps.html:
Let stream be a new WebTransportDatagramDuplexStream, with:

[[Readable]]

readable

[[Writable]]

writable

[[IncomingDatagramsQueue]]

an empty queue

[[IncomingDatagramsPullPromise]]

null

[[IncomingDatagramsHighWaterMark]]

an implementation-defined value

[[IncomingDatagramsExpirationDuration]]

null

[[OutgoingDatagramsQueue]]

an empty queue

[[OutgoingDatagramsHighWaterMark]]

an implementation-defined value

[[OutgoingDatagramsExpirationDuration]]

null

[[OutgoingMaxDatagramSize]]

an implementation-defined integer.

algorithms.name: WebTransportDatagramDuplexStream/readable
algorithms.html: The getter steps are:

algorithms.name: WebTransportDatagramDuplexStream/writable
algorithms.html: The getter steps are:

algorithms.name: WebTransportDatagramDuplexStream/incomingMaxAge
algorithms.html: The getter steps are:

algorithms.name: WebTransportDatagramDuplexStream/incomingMaxAge
algorithms.html: The setter steps, given <var>value</var>, are:

steps.html: If value is negative or NaN, throw a RangeError.

algorithms.name: WebTransportDatagramDuplexStream/outgoingMaxAge
algorithms.html: The getter steps are:

algorithms.name: WebTransportDatagramDuplexStream/outgoingMaxAge
algorithms.html: The setter steps, given <var>value</var>, are:

steps.html: If value is negative or NaN, throw a RangeError.

algorithms.name: WebTransportDatagramDuplexStream/incomingHighWaterMark
algorithms.html: The getter steps are:

algorithms.name: WebTransportDatagramDuplexStream/incomingHighWaterMark
algorithms.html: The setter steps, given <var>value</var>, are:

steps.html: If value is negative or NaN, throw a RangeError.

algorithms.name: WebTransportDatagramDuplexStream/outgoingHighWaterMark
algorithms.html: The getter steps are:

algorithms.name: WebTransportDatagramDuplexStream/outgoingHighWaterMark
algorithms.html: The setter steps, given <var>value</var>, are:

steps.html: If value is negative or NaN, throw a RangeError.

algorithms.name: pullDatagrams
algorithms.html: To pullDatagrams, given a WebTransport object transport, run these steps:

steps.html: Set datagrams.[[IncomingDatagramsPullPromise]] to a new promise.
Let datagram and timestamp be the result of dequeuing queue.
If datagrams.[[Readable]]'s current BYOB request view is not null, then:
Let view be datagrams.[[Readable]]'s current BYOB request view.
If view’s byte length is less than the size of datagram, return a promise rejected with a RangeError.

Let elementSize be the element size specified in the typed array constructors table for view.[[TypedArrayName]]. If view does not have a [[TypedArrayName]] internal slot (i.e. it is a DataView), let elementSize be 0.
If elementSize is not 1, return a promise rejected with a TypeError.
Pull from bytes datagram into datagrams.[[Readable]].
Return a promise resolved with undefined.

algorithms.name: receiveDatagrams
algorithms.html: To receiveDatagrams, given a WebTransport object transport, run these steps:

steps.html: If duration is null, then set duration to an implementation-defined value.
While there are available incoming datagrams on session:
Let datagram be the result of receiving a datagram with session.
Let toBeRemoved be the length of queue minus datagrams.[[IncomingDatagramsHighWaterMark]].
If toBeRemoved is positive, repeat dequeuing queue toBeRemoved (rounded down) times.
If more than duration milliseconds have passed since timestamp, then dequeue queue.
If queue is not empty and datagrams.[[IncomingDatagramsPullPromise]] is non-null, then:
Let bytes and timestamp be the result of dequeuing queue.
Queue a network task with transport to run the following steps:
Let chunk be a new Uint8Array object representing bytes.

algorithms.name: writeDatagrams
algorithms.html: The writeDatagrams algorithm is given a transport as parameter and data as input. It is defined by running the following steps:

steps.html: If data is not a BufferSource object, then return a promise rejected with a TypeError.
If datagrams.[[OutgoingMaxDatagramSize]] is less than data’s [[ByteLength]], return a promise resolved with undefined.
Let bytes be a copy of bytes which data represents.
If the length of datagrams.[[OutgoingDatagramsQueue]] is less than datagrams.[[OutgoingDatagramsHighWaterMark]], then resolve promise with undefined.

algorithms.name: sendDatagrams
algorithms.html: To sendDatagrams, given a WebTransport object transport, run these steps:

steps.html: If duration is null, then set duration to an implementation-defined value.
If more than <var>duration</var> milliseconds have passed since <var>timestamp</var>, then:
Queue a network task with transport to resolve promise with undefined.
If transport.[[State]] is not "connected", then return.
If it is not possible to send bytes to the network immediately, then break this loop.
Send a datagram, with transport.[[Session]] and bytes.
Queue a network task with transport to resolve promise with undefined.

algorithms.name: webtransport-contructor
algorithms.html: When the WebTransport() constructor is invoked, the user agent MUST run the following steps:

steps.html: Let baseURL be this's relevant settings object's API base URL.
Let parsedURL be the URL record resulting from parsing url with baseURL.
If parsedURL is a failure, throw a SyntaxError exception.
If parsedURL scheme is not https, throw a SyntaxError exception.
If parsedURL fragment is not null, throw a SyntaxError exception.
Let serverCertificateHashes be options's serverCertificateHashes if it exists, and null otherwise.
If dedicated is false and serverCertificateHashes is non-null, then throw a NotSupportedError exception.

If congestionControl is not "default", and the user agent does not support any congestion control algorithms that optimize for congestionControl, as allowed by [RFC9002] Section 7, then set congestionControl to "default".

If any of the values in protocols occur more than once, fail to match the requirements for elements that comprise the value of WT-Protocol fields as defined by the WebTransport protocol, or have an isomorphic encoded length of 0 or exceeding 512, throw a SyntaxError exception. [WEB-TRANSPORT-HTTP3] Section 3.4.
Let incomingDatagrams be a new ReadableStream.
Let outgoingDatagrams be a new WritableStream.
Let datagrams be the result of creating a WebTransportDatagramDuplexStream, its readable set to incomingDatagrams and its writable set to outgoingDatagrams.

Let transport be a newly constructed WebTransport object, with:

[[SendStreams]]

an empty ordered set

[[ReceiveStreams]]

an empty ordered set

[[IncomingBidirectionalStreams]]

a new ReadableStream

[[IncomingUnidirectionalStreams]]

a new ReadableStream

[[State]]

"connecting"

[[Ready]]

a new promise

[[Reliability]]

"pending"

[[CongestionControl]]

congestionControl

[[AnticipatedConcurrentIncomingUnidirectionalStreams]]

anticipatedConcurrentIncomingUnidirectionalStreams

[[AnticipatedConcurrentIncomingBidirectionalStreams]]

anticipatedConcurrentIncomingBidirectionalStreams

[[Protocol]]

an empty string

[[Closed]]

a new promise

[[Draining]]

a new promise

[[Datagrams]]

datagrams

[[Session]]

null
Let pullDatagramsAlgorithm be an action that runs pullDatagrams with transport.
Let writeDatagramsAlgorithm be an action that runs writeDatagrams with transport.

algorithms.name: webtransport-contructor
algorithms.html: When the WebTransport() constructor is invoked, the user agent MUST run the following steps:

steps.html: Set up with byte reading support incomingDatagrams with pullAlgorithm set to pullDatagramsAlgorithm, and highWaterMark set to 0.
Set up outgoingDatagrams with writeAlgorithm set to writeDatagramsAlgorithm.
Let pullBidirectionalStreamAlgorithm be an action that runs pullBidirectionalStream with transport.
Set up transport.[[IncomingBidirectionalStreams]] with pullAlgorithm set to pullBidirectionalStreamAlgorithm, and highWaterMark set to 0.
Let pullUnidirectionalStreamAlgorithm be an action that runs pullUnidirectionalStream with transport.
Set up transport.[[IncomingUnidirectionalStreams]] with pullAlgorithm set to pullUnidirectionalStreamAlgorithm, and highWaterMark set to 0.
Initialize WebTransport over HTTP with transport, parsedURL, dedicated, requireUnreliable, congestionControl, protocols, and serverCertificateHashes.

algorithms.name: initialize WebTransport over HTTP
algorithms.html: To initialize WebTransport over HTTP, given a WebTransport object transport, a URL record url, a boolean dedicated, a boolean requireUnreliable, a WebTransportCongestionControl congestionControl, a protocols array, and a sequence<WebTransportHash> serverCertificateHashes, run these steps.

steps.html: Let request be a new request whose URL is url, client is client, policy container is client’s policy container, destination is an empty string, origin is origin and redirect mode is "error".
Run report Content Security Policy violations for request.

If should request be blocked by Content Security Policy? with request returns "Blocked", or if request should be blocked due to a bad port returns blocked, then abort the remaining steps and queue a network task with transport to run these steps:
If transport.[[State]] is "closed" or "failed", then abort these steps.
Let error be a newly created WebTransportError whose source is "session".
Let networkPartitionKey be the result of determining the network partition key with transport’s relevant settings object.
Run the following steps in parallel, but abort when transport.[[State]] becomes "closed" or "failed":

Let connection be the result of obtaining a connection with networkPartitionKey, url, false, newConnection, and requireUnreliable. If the user agent supports more than one congestion control algorithm, choose one appropriate for congestionControl for sending of data on this connection. When obtaining a connection, if serverCertificateHashes is specified, instead of using the default certificate verification algorithm, consider the certificate valid if it meets the custom certificate requirements and if verifying the certificate hash against serverCertificateHashes returns true. If either condition is not met, let connection be failure.
If connection is failure, then abort the remaining steps and queue a network task with transport to run these steps:
If transport.[[State]] is "closed" or "failed", then abort these steps.
Let error be a newly created WebTransportError whose source is "session".
Wait for connection to receive the first SETTINGS frame, and let settings be a dictionary that represents the SETTINGS frame.

If settings doesn’t contain SETTINGS_ENABLE_WEBTRANPORT with a value of 1, or it doesn’t contain H3_DATAGRAM with a value of 1, then abort the remaining steps and queue a network task with transport to run these steps:
If transport.[[State]] is "closed" or "failed", then abort these steps.
Let error be a newly created WebTransportError whose source is "session".
Establish a WebTransport session with origin and protocols on connection.
If the previous step fails, abort the remaining steps and queue a network task with transport to run these steps:
If transport.[[State]] is "closed" or "failed", then abort these steps.
Let error be a newly created WebTransportError whose source is "session".
Queue a network task with transport to run these steps:

Set transport.[[Protocol]] to either the string value of the WT-Protocol header field in the 2xx response to the CONNECT request if present, following [WEB-TRANSPORT-HTTP3] Section 3.4, or "" if not present.
If the connection is an HTTP/3 connection, set transport.[[Reliability]] to "supports-unreliable".
If the connection is an HTTP/2 connection [WEB-TRANSPORT-HTTP2], set transport’s [[Reliability]] to "reliable-only".

algorithms.name: pullBidirectionalStream
algorithms.html: To pullBidirectionalStream, given a WebTransport object transport, run these steps.

steps.html: If transport.[[State]] is "connecting", then return the result of performing the following steps upon fulfillment of transport.[[Ready]]:
If transport.[[State]] is not "connected", then return a new rejected promise with an InvalidStateError.
Run the following steps in parallel:
Wait until there is an available incoming bidirectional stream.
Let internalStream be the result of receiving a bidirectional stream.
Queue a network task with transport to run these steps:
Let stream be the result of creating a WebTransportBidirectionalStream with internalStream and transport.

algorithms.name: pullUnidirectionalStream
algorithms.html: To pullUnidirectionalStream, given a WebTransport object transport, run these steps.

steps.html: If transport.[[State]] is "connecting", then return the result of performing the following steps upon fulfillment of transport.[[Ready]]:
If transport.[[State]] is not "connected", then return a new rejected promise with an InvalidStateError.
Run the following steps in parallel:
Wait until there is an available incoming unidirectional stream.
Let internalStream be the result of receiving an incoming unidirectional stream.
Queue a network task with transport to run these steps:
Let stream be the result of creating a WebTransportReceiveStream with internalStream and transport.

algorithms.name: WebTransport/datagrams
algorithms.html: A single duplex stream for sending and receiving datagrams over this session. The getter steps for the datagrams attribute SHALL be:

algorithms.name: WebTransport/incomingBidirectionalStreams
algorithms.html: Returns a ReadableStream of WebTransportBidirectionalStreams that have been received from the server. The getter steps for the incomingBidirectionalStreams attribute SHALL be:

algorithms.name: WebTransport/incomingUnidirectionalStreams
algorithms.html: A ReadableStream of unidirectional streams, each represented by a WebTransportReceiveStream, that have been received from the server. The getter steps for incomingUnidirectionalStreams are:

algorithms.name: WebTransport/close(closeInfo)
algorithms.html:
close(closeInfo)

Terminates the WebTransport session associated with the WebTransport object.

When close is called, the user agent MUST run the following steps:

steps.html: If transport.[[State]] is "closed" or "failed", then abort these steps.
Let error be a newly created WebTransportError whose source is "session".
Let reasonString be the maximal code unit prefix of closeInfo.reason where the length of the UTF-8 encoded prefix doesn’t exceed 1024.
In parallel, terminate session with code and reason.

algorithms.name: WebTransport/getStats()
algorithms.html: When getStats is called, the user agent MUST run the following steps:

steps.html: If transport.[[State]] is "failed", reject p with an InvalidStateError and abort these steps.
Run the following steps in parallel:
If transport.[[State]] is "connecting", wait until it changes.
If transport.[[State]] is "failed", reject p with an InvalidStateError and abort these steps.

If transport.[[State]] is "closed", resolve p with the most recent stats available for the connection and abort these steps. The exact point at which those stats are collected is implementation-defined.
Gather the stats from the underlying connection, including stats on datagrams.
Queue a network task with transport to run the following steps:
Let stats be a new WebTransportConnectionStats object representing the gathered stats.

algorithms.name: WebTransport/createBidirectionalStream(options)
algorithms.html: When createBidirectionalStream is called, the user agent MUST run the following steps:

steps.html: If transport.[[State]] is "closed" or "failed", return a new rejected promise with an InvalidStateError.
Run the following steps in parallel, but abort when transport’s [[State]] becomes "closed" or "failed", and instead queue a network task with transport to reject p with an InvalidStateError:

Let streamId be a new stream ID that is valid and unique for transport.[[Session]], as defined in [QUIC] Section 19.11. If one is not immediately available due to exhaustion, wait for it to become available if waitUntilAvailable is true, reject p with a QuotaExceededError and abort these steps otherwise.
Let internalStream be the result of creating a bidirectional stream with transport.[[Session]] and streamId.
Queue a network task with transport to run the following steps:
If transport.[[State]] is "closed" or "failed", reject p with an InvalidStateError and abort these steps.
Let stream be the result of creating a WebTransportBidirectionalStream with internalStream, transport, sendGroup, and sendOrder.

algorithms.name: WebTransport/createUnidirectionalStream(options)
algorithms.html: When createUnidirectionalStream() method is called, the user agent MUST run the following steps:

steps.html: If transport.[[State]] is "closed" or "failed", return a new rejected promise with an InvalidStateError.
Run the following steps in parallel, but abort when transport’s [[State]] becomes "closed" or "failed", and instead queue a network task with transport to reject p with an InvalidStateError:

Let streamId be a new stream ID that is valid and unique for transport.[[Session]], as defined in [QUIC] Section 19.11. If one is not immediately available due to exhaustion, wait for it to become available if waitUntilAvailable is true, reject p with a QuotaExceededError and abort these steps otherwise.
Let internalStream be the result of creating an outgoing unidirectional stream with transport.[[Session]] and streamId.
Queue a network task with transport to run the following steps:
If transport.[[State]] is "closed" or "failed", reject p with an InvalidStateError and abort these steps.
Let stream be the result of creating a WebTransportSendStream with internalStream, transport, sendGroup, and sendOrder.

algorithms.name: WebTransport/createSendGroup()
algorithms.html: When createSendGroup() method is called, the user agent MUST run the following steps:

steps.html: If transport.[[State]] is "closed" or "failed", throw an InvalidStateError.
Return the result of creating a WebTransportSendGroup with transport.

algorithms.name: cleanup a WebTransport
algorithms.html: To cleanup a WebTransport transport with error and optionally closeInfo, run these steps:

steps.html: Let sendStreams be a copy of transport.[[SendStreams]].
Let receiveStreams be a copy of transport.[[ReceiveStreams]].
Set transport.[[SendStreams]] to an empty set.
Set transport.[[ReceiveStreams]] to an empty set.
Set transport.[[Datagrams]].[[OutgoingDatagramsQueue]] to an empty queue.
Set transport.[[Datagrams]].[[IncomingDatagramsQueue]] to an empty queue.
If closeInfo is given, then set transport.[[State]] to "closed". Otherwise, set transport.[[State]] to "failed".
For each stream in sendStreams, run the following steps:
If stream.[[PendingOperation]] is not null, reject stream.[[PendingOperation]] with error.
For each stream in receiveStreams, error stream with error.

algorithms.name: WebTransport/queue a network task
algorithms.html: To queue a network task with a WebTransport transport and a series of steps steps, run these steps:

steps.html: Queue a global task on the network task source with transport’s relevant global object to run steps.

algorithms.name: termination-initiated-by-server
algorithms.html: Whenever a WebTransport session which is associated with a WebTransport transport is terminated with optionally code and reasonBytes, run these steps:

steps.html: Queue a network task with transport to run these steps:
If transport.[[State]] is "closed" or "failed", abort these steps.
Let error be a newly created WebTransportError whose source is "session".
Let closeInfo be a new WebTransportCloseInfo.
If code is given, set closeInfo’s closeCode to code.
If reasonBytes is given, set closeInfo’s reason to reasonBytes, UTF-8 decoded.

algorithms.name: termination-caused-by-connection-error
algorithms.html: Whenever a WebTransport transport’s underlying connection gets a connection error, run these steps:

steps.html: Queue a network task with transport to run these steps:
If transport.[[State]] is "closed" or "failed", abort these steps.
Let error be a newly created WebTransportError whose source is "session".

algorithms.name: context cleanup steps
algorithms.html: This specification defines context cleanup steps as the following steps, given WebTransport transport:

steps.html: In parallel, terminate transport.[[Session]].
Queue a network task with transport to run the following steps:
Let error be a newly created WebTransportError whose source is "session".
If transport.[[State]] is "connecting", set transport.[[State]] to "failed".

algorithms.name: compute a certificate hash
algorithms.html: To compute a certificate hash, given a certificate, perform the following steps:

steps.html: Let cert be certificate, represented as a DER encoding of Certificate message defined in [RFC5280].
Compute the SHA-256 hash of cert and return the computed value.

algorithms.name: verify a certificate hash
algorithms.html: To verify a certificate hash, given a certificate and an array of hashes hashes, perform the following steps:

steps.html: Let referenceHash be the result of computing a certificate hash with certificate.
If hash.value is not null and hash.algorithm is an ASCII case-insensitive match with "sha-256":
Let hashValue be the byte sequence which hash.value represents.

algorithms.name: WebTransportSendStream/sendGroup
algorithms.html: The getter steps are:

algorithms.name: WebTransportSendStream/sendGroup
algorithms.html: The setter steps, given <var>value</var>, are:

steps.html: If value is non-null, and value.[[Transport]] is not this.[[Transport]], throw an InvalidStateError.

algorithms.name: WebTransportSendStream/sendOrder
algorithms.html: The getter steps are:

algorithms.name: WebTransportSendStream/sendOrder
algorithms.html: The setter steps, given <var>value</var>, are:

algorithms.name: WebTransportSendStream/getStats()
algorithms.html: When getStats is called, the user agent MUST run the following steps:

steps.html: Run the following steps in parallel:
Gather the stats specific to this WebTransportSendStream.
Wait for the stats to be ready.
Queue a network task with transport to run the following steps:
Let stats be a new WebTransportSendStreamStats object representing the gathered stats.

algorithms.name: create a SendStream
algorithms.html: To create a WebTransportSendStream, with an outgoing unidirectional or bidirectional WebTransport stream internalStream, a WebTransport transport, sendGroup, and a sendOrder, run these steps:

steps.html:
Let stream be a new WebTransportSendStream, with:

[[InternalStream]]

internalStream

[[PendingOperation]]

null

[[Transport]]

transport

[[SendGroup]]

sendGroup

[[SendOrder]]

sendOrder

[[AtomicWriteRequests]]

An empty ordered set of promises.
Let writeAlgorithm be an action that writes chunk to stream, given chunk.
Let abortAlgorithm be an action that aborts stream with reason, given reason.
Set up stream with writeAlgorithm set to writeAlgorithm, closeAlgorithm set to closeAlgorithm, abortAlgorithm set to abortAlgorithm.
Add the following steps to abortSignal.
If pendingOperation is null, then abort these steps.
Let promise be the result of aborting stream with reason.
Upon fulfillment of promise, reject pendingOperation with reason.

algorithms.name: WebTransportSendStream/write
algorithms.html: To write chunk to a WebTransportSendStream stream, run these steps:

steps.html: If chunk is not a BufferSource, return a promise rejected with a TypeError.
Let bytes be a copy of the byte sequence which chunk represents.
Let atomic be true if stream.[[AtomicWriteRequests]] contains inFlightWriteRequest, otherwise false.
Run the following steps in parallel:
If atomic is true and the current flow control window is too small for bytes to be sent in its entirety, then abort the remaining steps and queue a network task with transport to run these sub-steps:
Abort all atomic write requests on stream.

Otherwise, send bytes on stream.[[InternalStream]] and wait for the operation to complete. This sending MAY be interleaved with sending of previously queued streams and datagrams, as well as streams and datagrams yet to be queued to be sent over this transport. Datagrams SHOULD be given priority over this sending, but not to the point of starving it.

The user-agent MAY have a buffer to improve the transfer performance. Such a buffer SHOULD have a fixed upper limit, to carry the backpressure information to the user of the WebTransportSendStream.

This sending MUST starve until all bytes queued for sending on WebTransportSendStreams with the same [[SendGroup]] and a higher [[SendOrder]], that are neither errored nor blocked by flow control, have been sent.

We access stream.[[SendOrder]] in parallel here. User agents SHOULD respond to live updates of these values during sending, though the details are implementation-defined.

This sending MUST NOT starve otherwise, except for flow control reasons or error.

The user agent SHOULD divide bandwidth fairly between all streams that aren’t starved.
If the previous step failed due to a network error, abort the remaining steps.
Otherwise, queue a network task with transport to run these steps:
If stream.[[AtomicWriteRequests]] contains inFlightWriteRequest, remove inFlightWriteRequest.

algorithms.name: WebTransportSendStream/close
algorithms.html: To close a WebTransportSendStream stream, run these steps:

steps.html: Run the following steps in parallel:
Send FIN on stream.[[InternalStream]] and wait for the operation to complete.
Wait for stream.[[InternalStream]] to enter the "Data Recvd" state. [QUIC]
Queue a network task with transport to run these steps:

algorithms.name: WebTransportSendStream/abort
algorithms.html: To abort a WebTransportSendStream stream with reason, run these steps:

steps.html: If reason is a WebTransportError and reason.[[StreamErrorCode]] is not null, then set code to reason.[[StreamErrorCode]].
Run the following steps in parallel:
Queue a network task with transport to resolve promise with undefined.

algorithms.name: WebTransportSendStream/abort all atomic write requests
algorithms.html: To abort all atomic write requests on a WebTransportSendStream stream, run these steps:

steps.html: If writeRequests contains a promise not in requestsToAbort, then error stream with AbortError, and abort these steps.
For each promise in requestsToAbort, reject promise with AbortError.
In parallel, for each promise in requestsToAbort, abort the sending of bytes associated with promise.

algorithms.name: STOP_SENDING signal
algorithms.html: Whenever a WebTransport stream associated with a WebTransportSendStream stream gets a STOP_SENDING signal from the server, run these steps:

steps.html: Let code be the application protocol error code attached to the STOP_SENDING frame. [QUIC]
Queue a network task with transport to run these steps:
If transport.[[State]] is "closed" or "failed", abort these steps.
Let error be a newly created WebTransportError whose source is "stream" and streamErrorCode is code.
If stream.[[PendingOperation]] is not null, reject stream.[[PendingOperation]] with error.

algorithms.name: WebTransportSendGroup/getStats()
algorithms.html: When getStats is called, the user agent MUST run the following steps:

steps.html: Let streams be all WebTransportSendStreams whose [[SendGroup]] is this.
Run the following steps in parallel:
Gather stream statistics from all streams in streams.
Queue a network task with transport to run the following steps:
Let stats be a new WebTransportSendStreamStats object representing the aggregate numbers of the gathered stats.

algorithms.name: create a SendGroup
algorithms.html: To create a WebTransportSendGroup, with a WebTransport transport, run these steps:

steps.html:
Let sendGroup be a new WebTransportSendGroup, with:

[[Transport]]

transport

algorithms.name: WebTransportReceiveStream/getStats()
algorithms.html: When getStats is called, the user agent MUST run the following steps:

steps.html: Run the following steps in parallel:
Gather the stats specific to this WebTransportReceiveStream.
Queue a network task with transport to run the following steps:
Let stats be a new WebTransportReceiveStreamStats object representing the gathered stats.

algorithms.name: WebTransportReceiveStream/create
algorithms.html: To create a WebTransportReceiveStream, with an incoming unidirectional or bidirectional WebTransport stream internalStream and a WebTransport transport, run these steps:

steps.html:
Let stream be a new WebTransportReceiveStream, with:

[[InternalStream]]

internalStream

[[Transport]]

transport
Let pullAlgorithm be an action that pulls bytes from stream.
Let cancelAlgorithm be an action that cancels stream with reason, given reason.
Set up with byte reading support stream with pullAlgorithm set to pullAlgorithm and cancelAlgorithm set to cancelAlgorithm.

algorithms.name: WebTransportReceiveStream/pull bytes
algorithms.html: To pull bytes from a WebTransportReceiveStream stream, run these steps.

steps.html: If stream’s current BYOB request view for stream is not null:
Set maxBytes to stream’s current BYOB request view's byte length.
Set buffer to stream’s current BYOB request view's underlying buffer.
Set buffer be a new ArrayBuffer with maxBytes size. If allocating the ArrayBuffer fails, return a promise rejected with a RangeError.
Run the following steps in parallel:

Write the bytes that area read from internalStream into buffer with offset offset, up to maxBytes bytes. Wait until either at least one byte is read or FIN is received. Let read be the number of read bytes, and let hasReceivedFIN be whether FIN was accompanied.

The user-agent MAY have a buffer to improve the transfer performance. Such a buffer SHOULD have a fixed upper limit, to carry the backpressure information to the server.
If the previous step failed, abort the remaining steps.
Queue a network task with transport to run these steps:
Set view to a new Uint8Array with buffer, offset and read.

algorithms.name: WebTransportReceiveStream/cancel
algorithms.html: To cancel a WebTransportReceiveStream stream with reason, run these steps.

steps.html: If reason is a WebTransportError and reason.[[StreamErrorCode]] is not null, then set code to reason.[[StreamErrorCode]].
Run the following steps in parallel:
Queue a network task with transport to run these steps:

algorithms.name: reset signal
algorithms.html: Whenever a WebTransport stream associated with a WebTransportReceiveStream stream gets a RESET_STREAM signal from the server, run these steps:

steps.html: Let code be the application protocol error code attached to the RESET_STREAM frame. [QUIC]
Queue a network task with transport to run these steps:
If transport.[[State]] is "closed" or "failed", abort these steps.
Let error be a newly created WebTransportError whose source is "stream" and streamErrorCode is code.

algorithms.name: create a BidirectionalStream
algorithms.html: To create a WebTransportBidirectionalStream with a bidirectional WebTransport stream internalStream, a WebTransport object transport, and a sendOrder, run these steps.

steps.html: Let readable be the result of creating a WebTransportReceiveStream with internalStream and transport.
Let writable be the result of creating a WebTransportSendStream with internalStream, transport, and sendOrder.

Let stream be a new WebTransportBidirectionalStream, with:

[[Readable]]

readable

[[Writable]]

writable

[[Transport]]

transport

algorithms.name: WebTransportWriter/atomicWrite(chunk)
algorithms.html: When atomicWrite is called, the user agent MUST run the following steps:

steps.html: Let p be the result of write(chunk) on WritableStreamDefaultWriter with chunk.
Return the result of reacting to p with the following steps:
If stream.[[AtomicWriteRequests]] contains p, remove p.
If p was rejected with reason r, then return a promise rejected with r.

algorithms.name: create a writer
algorithms.html: To create a WebTransportWriter, with a WebTransportSendStream stream, run these steps:

steps.html: Let writer be a new WebTransportWriter.
Run the new WritableStreamDefaultWriter(stream) constructor steps passing writer as this, and stream as the constructor argument.

algorithms.name: WebTransportError/WebTransportError(message, options)
algorithms.html: The new WebTransportError(message, options) constructor steps are:

steps.html:
Set this’s internal slots as follows:

[[Source]]

options.source

[[StreamErrorCode]]

options.streamErrorCode

algorithms.html: WebTransportError objects are serializable objects. Their serialization steps, given value and serialized, are:

steps.html: Run the DOMException serialization steps given value and serialized.

algorithms.html: Their deserialization steps, given serialized and value, are:

steps.html: Run the DOMException deserialization steps given serialized and value.
